description:
In July the Sun is hot. Is there a meeting? Yes, why not!

Talks:

• Benjamin (@apneadiving): Death To Callbacks!


• Dumitru (@doomhz): NodeJS for Rubyists


Sponsors:

• Drinks/Dinner: Benjamin Roth (@apneadiving)

• Venue: PullReview

Ping me via meetup or twitter @_toch if:

• you'd like to speak
name: BRUG July 2014

description:
Back from Holidays? Time to get back to your Rubies during those last summer days. Let's meet up!

Lineup:

• REST APIs, Authentication, Authorization, and JSON serialization by @YoranBrondsema 

• ... by @xavierdefrang


Sponsors:

• Hosted by 10to1

• Drink/Food: PullReview

Ping me via meetup or Twitter @_toch.
name: BRUG August 2014

description:
"All the fruit will mature in a warm and dry September", it is said. Even if our September is cold and wet, let's harvest our Rubies and share them together.

Lineup

• Sum or average are not right benchmark measures by @_toch

• Rails + Angular.js by @apneadiving


Sponsors:

• host: UP-nxt

• dinner: you?


Would you want to give a talk or sponsor the dinner, ping me on Twitter.
name: BRUG September 2014

description:
CodeWeek will occur next week. I think it's a good idea to welcome new comers and introduce Ruby if we want to grow the community.

The program:
- a short introduction of the community
- 2 short talks about Ruby (by Bert and Kevin)
- play with TryRuby and/or RubyWarrior

It's on short notice, but I think we can make it. Let's show how we are still vibrant!

If you want to help (coach/talk/sponsor), fill the form: http://goo.gl/forms/vMxUKJa5kF

Christophe / @_toch
name: BRUG October 2014: CodeWeek

description:
Dull November brings the blast,
Then the rubies are whirling fast.

During last BRUG, people were helping new comers to code and helping each others. After asking attendants, it seems that coding and hacking together could do a nice BRUG variation.


This time, rather than listening to talks, let's code together. It's simple: bring your current code problem, code on an open source project, or just come to help. 

List of projects:

• Boris Rorsvort: updating Emuzikos to Rails 4. Emuzikos is a rails app and its a non-profit maybe soon to be open source.

• Olivier Van Hamme: I'd like to bring a Rails project to the table as well. I will share the (ruby) challenges next week. First I need to structure them. 

• Gilles Seerden: would like to explore (1) Live Streaming in Rails 4. (2) Websockets.
name: BRUG November 2014: Hack evening
